channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Leaders, Stop Forcing Change Strategy. Do This Instead.
item.description: Change strategy shouldn’t be a static plan obsessed with the destination. It should be an iterative process focused on the journey.

item.title: Hinge’s founder and CEO is stepping down to start a new AI-first dating app
item.description: The new venture will use AI “to help people connect in a more thoughtful and personal way.”

item.title: Fed’s Powell voices fear of K-shaped economy: ‘How sustainable it is, I don’t know’
item.description: Powell said most consumer consumption comes from the rich. "The top third accounts for way more than a third of the consumption ... So it’s a good que...

item.title: Cursor has growing revenue and a $29 billion valuation—but CEO Michael Truell isn’t thinking about an IPO
item.description: CEO Michael Truell says the AI coding startup hit $1 billion in annualized revenue last month—but it's focused on building features, not going public.

item.title: Want the same milk and eggs? Instacart might charge you more than your neighbor
item.description: Instacart ’s artificial intelligence -enabled pricing may be increasing the cost of your groceries by as much as $1,200 a year, according to a new stu...

item.title: Flighty’s Passport Recap Shows You What Airlines Won’t
item.description: The best travel app just released its first-ever global recap based on 22 million flights in 2025.

item.title: ComfortDelGro joins Singapore’s race for autonomous vehicles with new shuttle trials and public rides by 2026
item.description: Both ComfortDelGro and ride-hailing platform Grab plan to roll out AVs to the public by next year.

item.title: Why the U.S. oil industry is skeptical of Trump’s ‘pro-petroleum’ plans
item.description: As the Trump administration makes announcement after announcement about its efforts to promote the U.S. fossil fuel industry, the industry isn’t exact...

item.title: ‘We have not seen this rosy picture’: ADP’s chief economist warns the real economy is pretty different from Wall Street’s bullish outlook
item.description: "We're tracking changes in real time, it's as high frequency as payroll data [can] get and we have not seen this rosy picture for 2026 in the data," A...

item.title: 2026 might be the year we finally give up on fashion trends
item.description: Remember earlier this year when everyone on your feed was wearing bizarre shoes, like Maison Margiella’s ballerina flats with split toes and mesh ball...

item.title: These basketball courts double as a hidden flood defense
item.description: They look like ordinary basketball courts. But two new courts built next to public housing in New York City double as flood prevention. In a sudden fl...

item.title: ‘A willingness to lie’: Why the EPA’s latest Trump-era change is especially concerning
item.description: Human activity is driving climate change; that’s a fact that more than 99.9% of scientific papers agree on. But the Environmental Protection Agency (E...

item.title: How Troy Aikman’s ‘Trillion Dollar Venn Diagram of Success’ Made Him Remarkably Successful
item.description: Aikman doesn’t call it that, but HubSpot co-founder Dharmesh Shah does, and here’s how yours can make you remarkably successful.

item.title: How Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater Presents a Masterclass in Branding
item.description: Alicia Graf Mack, the iconic company’s new artistic director, is all-in on meeting audiences where they are.

item.title: I Supervise an Abusive Manager
item.description: … and two other tricky workplace dilemmas.
